block.p: In addition to slide shows of photographs of the Silk Road, Antarctica, Shanghai and Nascar fans in Concord, N.C., the Travel Web site this week offers additional features:

Michele McNally, assistant managing editor for photography at The Times, describes what she thinks makes a great travel picture, illustrated by a slide show of photos from the Travel section's archives.
A slide show of photographs documenting the life of fishing villages along the Mekong River in southern Laos.
A guide to the top photo shows of 2007 -- from the Venice Biennale to the opening of the first gallery at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York devoted to contemporary photography.
And Matt Gross, the Frugal Traveler columnist, continues his road trip across America, with his reports and video postcards appearing each Wednesday.
